task.title: Adjusting Crankshaft Main Bearings
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to adjust or replace worn crankshaft main bearings when engine pounding indicates wear.

prereq.p: Before beginning this procedure, the engine must be removed from the car.

substep.cmd: Remove the crank case
Remove the transmission cover
Remove the cylinder head
Remove pistons and connecting rods
Remove transmission
Remove magneto coils
Remove the three babbitted caps
Clean all bearing surfaces with gasoline
Apply Prussian blue or red lead to crankshaft bearing surfaces

info.note: This coating will help indicate contact points during fitting

substep.cmd: Position the rear cap
Tighten bolts firmly without stripping threads
Test the fit by turning crankshaft by hand

info.note: Crankshaft should turn with one hand. If too tight, add brass shims. If too loose, remove shims and file cap surface.

substep.cmd: Check blue/red markings for full-length bearing contact
Scrape babbitt and refit if necessary until proper contact is achieved
Repeat fitting process for center bearing
Repeat fitting process for front bearing

info.note: Adjust each bearing individually with other bearings removed

substep.cmd: Clean all babbitt surfaces thoroughly
Apply lubricating oil to all bearing surfaces and crankshaft
Install shims in their proper positions
Tighten cap bolts fully

info.note: Don't worry about over-tightening - shims and oil will prevent too close contact

result.note: Failure to oil bearing surfaces before assembly can result in babbitt damage during initial startup.

postreq.p: When reinstalling crank case and transmission cover:

ul.li: Use new gaskets to prevent oil leaks
Ensure all assemblies are properly aligned
Verify all fasteners are properly torqued
